article: A daughter complained to her father about her life and _ things have been so hard for her. It seemed that just as _ one problem was solved another _ .  Her father, a cook, took her to the kitchen , filled three pots with water and _ them on the fire. Soon the three pots came to a _ . He placed carrots, eggs, and coffee beans into them _ . He let them boil, without _ a word. In half a(n) _ he walked over to the stove and turned off the fire. He pulled out the carrots and the eggs, ladled out the _ and put them in three different bowls. He brought her closer and asked her to _ the carrots. They were soft. He then asked her to take an egg and _ it. She pulled off the shell and observed the hard-boiled egg. _ , he asked her to sip the coffee. She _ , as she tasted its rich aroma . "What does it mean, Father?" she asked. "Each of them faced the same difficult situation, 212 degrees of boiling water." he explained, "However, each _ differently. The carrot was strong and hard, but soon became _ . The egg was fragile with a _ shell and a liquid center. Then its inside became hardened. The coffee beans were unique. They had changed the water." " _ are you?" he asked, "When a difficult situation knocks on your door, how do you respond? Are you a carrot, an egg, or a coffee bean?"
